Negro personnel in the pary's
national headquarters.


The George Lewis in ques-
ton is the chief librarian. He
has been in the employ of the
Republican National Committee
since l948. Other personalities
featured in the booklet include
Clay ]. Claiborne. Special As
sistant to the National Chairman
and head of the Committee Min
critics Division: Miss Albertine
("Tina") Bowie. Special assist
ant to Assistant National Chair
man ELY Peterson; Edward Peete
in charge of mailing and shipping
activities, and attorney Grant
Reynolds, who holds the title of
Special Counsel to the Chair
man.


The booklet shows graphically
that Negroes hold highly respon-
sible positions within the COP
nerve center and they are vet
Grams Of many past campaigns.


To obtain copies send request
to Republican National Commit
tee.. 1925 Eye St. NV. Wash
ington DC.

NEW YORK = Arnold Coldwag,
a leader of the Brooklyn CORE
chapter, was sentenced to Is
months In jail.


Goldwag has continued disor-
derby civil rights demonstrations
while on probation.


AS soon as his sentence was
announced, Goldwag fell to the
floor shouting, "Ku Klux Nan."


The 26 yr. old son of Jewish
garment maker and the brother
of a rabbi, Goldwag helped plan
the worlds fair stall in.

Whitfield, treasurer and Warren
Mason. United Fund coordinator.


Charles Harlins is executive
director; William Bell, Jr.. is
associate director and Mrs. Al
cardio Douglass. Jr.. is secre-
tary.
New Officers Named By Urbun League

New officers of the Phoenix Ur-
ban League have been announced.
They are Edward Peplow; Jr.,
president; DR.. David Wormley,
LIST vice president; Budd Peabody.
End vice president; Mrs. Clar-
ence Laing, secretary: STROLLER

The combined groups of New Home Baptist
Church, sponsored a dinner program Friday
